abstract: Friends and colleagues differed as to whether Marcus W. Brauchli was being forced out or leaving out of frustration.
snippet: Friends and colleagues differed as to whether Marcus W. Brauchli was being forced out or leaving out of frustration.
lead_paragraph: Marcus W. Brauchli will step down as the top-ranking editor of The Wall Street Journal after less than a year in the job, four people briefed on the matter said on Monday, just four months after Rupert Murdoch took control of the paper.

headline.main: Wall St. Journal Editor Expected to Resign
headline.print_headline: Top Editor Of Journal Reportedly Resigning

abstract: Just four months after Rupert Murdoch took control of Dow Jones, the parent company of The Wall Street Journal, the newspaper’s top editor, Marcus W. Brauchli, is expected to step down, according to reports.
lead_paragraph: Just four months after Rupert Murdoch took control of Dow Jones, the parent company of The Wall Street Journal, the newspaper’s top editor, Marcus W. Brauchli, is expected to step down, according to reports.

headline.main: Wall Street Journal Editor Expected to Resign
